summary: Small cottage, with a magical atmosphere, safe containers, follower friendly, all crafting tables and devices available for different character types
descriptionHtml:
I wanted a home that has a romantic ambience and would also fit my personality as a mage. Sure, I\'m the Arch mage of the college, but I really don\'t want to live there. If you are looking for a beautiful, but simple home, this may be the mod for you! I was looking for a step up from a shack, but definitely not a palace.

Requirements: 
-Skyrim (No DLC\'s)
-Game updated to 1.9+

Suggested mods (to have it look like the pictures - I really love these mods!):
-Immersive Saturation Boost 
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=128490856&searchtext=immersive+saturation+boost

-Improved Interior Lighting (For Realistic Lighting Mods)
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=13434&searchtext=improved+interior+lighting

Location: Across the River from the Solitude Lumber Mill (the night picture is of me looking right at it, you can see it right from the front door!)

What you Will find:
Safe Storage
Alchemy Table
Enchanter Table
Smelter
Chopping block
Forge (outside)
Cooking Spit
Navmeshed for NPC\'s (follower friendly)
In my opinion, a great atmosphere for a player that is great for someone wants ambience, beauty, small consolidated home, and space to add your own expansions to this mod; have fun!

What you will NOT find:
A nifty quest to get the key (sorry, this is my first mod ever-maybe later?)
Over-powered items 
Tons of displays and Mannequins

NOTES:
This is my first shot at Navmesh, so it is friendly but not perfect. If anyone has ideas about changing that, let me know! I used great tutorials to figure it out, but I know other people are better than I am at that! http://tesalliance.org/forums/index.php?/topic/4656-ck-basics-lesson-1/
Also, I do not know if this works with all/any ENB\'s, as I do not use one myself.
author: McLinorama
